page.title: 17AUTODROME,CROFT.
page.content: Until three years ago, part of the former war-time aerodrome at Croft was used as a car-racing and motor-cycling racing circuit. It was a well known international motor-cycling circuit which attracted riders from all over thr world. Recently a small part of it has been developed for Rallycross, and the remaining land is now used as farm land. Six Rallycross meetings are held each year, when the average attendance is about a thousand spectators. At major races, up to two thousand people attend, and these races are televised occasionally. As Rallycrossing becomes more established in this area, drivers from all over the country take part in the events. They and their supporters travel from all parts of the Britain.
